ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: About 3 hours per week for reading/homework assignments.
3hrs/wk

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: pro:comprehensive and all the assignments are really helpfulcon: too much slides...

This is a great class tought by one of the best professionals in the field. Several of the visiting lecturers were also extremely knowledgable and engaging. These are some of the major strengths in the class. There is also a field trip to YNHH. This field trip is helpful for students to gain a more comprehensive perspective of hospital epidemiology and infection control practices. The only weakness of this class is that there isn't enough time to cover many of the topics in full detail. Some details were also left out as a result of being beyond the scope of the class. Overall, more is better in this course as there is much to learn and keep up with in this field.

good overview, good selection of readings. I thought the assignments were appropriate and relevant to understanding of the course materials. I especially liked the in-class group activities.I thought the reading assignment lists were not easily accessible.There were too many separate documents outlining class requirements and readings. Perhaps consolidating them would make assignments easy to find.

This was a great course and I really enjoyed learning about the different topics in hospital epidemiology. The guest speakers were helpful in helping us understand material. I also thought the assignments, including the group project and exam, were helpful in reinforcing course topics. I really enjoyed the small class size.

Very informative and interesting class. The instructor keeps things interesting and is a very good lecturer with a lot of first-hand experience. There are 3 written HWs during the semester, all of which really added to my knowledge. The final was very fair and I think the take home final is an appropriate format for this course.
S: Projects, lectures, and hospital tourW: none

Very nice course. I learned a lot about hospital dynamics and I would recommend it to those who plan on working in a hospital.Really enjoyed the classroom debate.Really enjoyed the guest lecturers.Very well structured with fair exam/hw questions.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Humorous, stylish. Maybe talking a little fast

Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Dr. Dembry's class is fantastic! Her class should be a divisional requirement. She presents the course information clearly and concisely so that there is no confusion. Her expectations are high and she challenges students to think creatively. In some cases it was difficult to tell if she was asking rhetorical questions or if she wanted answers from the class. One weakness was her tendency to occasionally speak over the invited guest lecturers but it was mostly to share her wealth of knowledge.
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  She was always well prepared with lectures and readings.
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Dr. Dembry was really great! I enjoyed hearing her perspectives on topics from her background.
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Very good lecturer and extremely knowledgeable with a lot of experience in the topic.
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  S: Always available to meet with students and very knowledgableW: noneCo-instructors: Very nice and love her first lecture
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Very knowledgeable. Very open to students.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Highly recommend

This class is an excellent overview of the public healt infectious disease surveillance systems that are in place in hospitals around the Unites States. This is a fantastic class and I would recommend it to all YSPHers.
This was a really great course with great material. I would recommend it to anyone interested in hospital epidemiology and how Infection Control personnel work in hospitals to solve problems.
I would definitely recommend this course to any student who is even mildly interested in this subject because it is one of the better courses in the MPH program.

I really enjoyed the class. The lectures are very interesting and hospital tour was fun. Totally recommend it to EMD students should take this class, and especially if thinking in getting into Medical Student.
